Submissions

Your Voice Matters

Your unique ideas and perspectives are what make this magazine special. This is your chance to go beyond the curriculum and explore the STEM topics you're truly passionate about.

We're looking for articles that spark curiosity and conversation. Don't worry about being a "perfect" writer; our focus is on your unique voice and innovative thinking. Your article could be a deep dive into a fascinating subject, a profile of an influential figure or even a personal story about a project you've worked on.

Ready to share your insights with a global audience? Submit your full article below! You can also feel free to send us a short bio about yourself or link a social media account if you'd like to help connect with other readers. We can't wait to see what you've created!

Here's what you need to know before you submit your article.

Article Topics

We're looking for articles on biology, chemistry, physics, mathematics or computer science. You can also write about academic advice you think would be helpful to your peers.

Article Length

Please aim for around 500 words. This helps us keep the magazine engaging and allows us to feature lots of different voices.

Editing

We'll review all submissions and edit for grammar, clarity and length. We'll also fact-check key points. We'll be in touch to let you know if we'll be using your article.

Submission Format

You can either use the submission form on this page or email us at curiositasmagazine@hotmail.com

Response Time

We know you're excited and we're excited to read your work! We'll do our best to get back to you within 14 days.

Connect with Us

Feel free to send us a short bio about yourself and a link to your social media (like Instagram or LinkedIn) if you want to connect with other writers/readers. This is totally optional and there's no pressure at all!

Questions?

If you have any questions, you can always email us or send a direct message to our Instagram: @curiositas_mag

Article Topics

We're looking for articles on biology, chemistry, physics, mathematics or computer science. You can also write about academic advice you think would be helpful to your peers.
